name: Tabs Component
description: An accessible tabs component with horizontal and vertical orientation, automatic or manual activation, responsive overflow handling for many tabs, and motion that respects reduced-motion preferences.

aiAgentInstructions.summary: Implement an accessible tabs component with `tablist`, `tab`, and `tabpanel` semantics. Support horizontal and vertical orientation, automatic and manual activation modes, and robust overflow behavior (scrollable or overflow menu) for many tabs. Adapt to the detected framework and styling system.
keyFeatures: Manual activation mode (Enter/Space activates focused tab)
Fixed tabs for small tab counts
Optional overflow menu strategy for constrained spaces with icon trigger and anchored dropdown
Overflow menu keeps active tab visible in the main row whenever possible
Single active panel rendering by default to avoid layout overlap
Visible active indicator and focus ring
Optional async/loading panel state with pending indicators
Layout safety constraints for nested grid/flex containers
CRITICAL: Styling MUST match project conventions and use detected framework/styling system only
CRITICAL: Maintain ARIA relationships (`aria-controls`, `aria-labelledby`, `aria-selected`) and orientation metadata for vertical tabs
implementationSteps: 0. Detect framework and styling system before writing code
1. Build root container with tablist and associated tabpanel container
2. Render tabs with stable IDs and one active tab selected by default
3. Add ARIA roles and states: role='tablist', role='tab', role='tabpanel', aria-selected, aria-controls, aria-labelledby
4. Implement horizontal and vertical orientation behavior
5. Implement keyboard handling per WAI-ARIA tabs pattern with wrap behavior
6. Add activation model switch: automatic or manual activation
7. Support fixed and scrollable variants; keep active tab visible in scrollable mode
8. Add optional overflow strategy for many tabs (scroll buttons or icon-triggered overflow menu)
8.1 For overflow menu mode, keep active tab visible in the primary tab row whenever possible and move remaining tabs to menu
8.2 Position overflow trigger and dropdown in the same alignment context as the tab row to avoid detached controls
9. Add disabled tab behavior (focus and activation constraints)
10. Render only the active tabpanel by default; if keeping multiple panels mounted, inactive panels must be removed from layout flow
11. Add async handling with pending indicators and clear activation timing rules
12. Implement active indicator positioning and panel transition motion
13. Respect prefers-reduced-motion by reducing or removing transitions
14. Ensure responsive behavior and touch target size on small screens
15. Apply layout safety constraints in constrained containers (for example nested cards, grid and flex children)
16. Validate screen reader announcements and keyboard flow
17. Use only project tokens and existing styling patterns

framework.description: Detect framework dependencies and existing component patterns before implementation.
detectionSteps: Inspect existing interactive components for state and event patterns.
Follow existing conventions for controlled vs uncontrolled APIs.

stylingSystem.description: Detect and use the project's current styling system only.
detectionSteps: Identify Tailwind, SCSS, CSS Modules, styled-components, or other conventions.
Inspect component class naming and token usage.
Match existing focus ring, spacing, and motion patterns.
adaptationRules: If Tailwind is used, compose utility classes that match existing component conventions.
If SCSS/CSS is used, implement class-based styles and modifier classes for active/focus/disabled states.
If CSS Modules are used, keep styles local and map state to explicit class names.
If styled-components are used, derive state styles from theme tokens and component props.

designTokens.description: Reuse project color, spacing, typography, and motion tokens.
detectionSteps: Locate existing token files or theme configs.
Map tab indicator, focus ring, and panel spacing to those tokens.
Avoid introducing new ad-hoc color or spacing values where tokens already exist.

horizontal.Space: Activate focused tab in manual mode

vertical.Space: Activate focused tab in manual mode

focusManagement.entry: When focus enters tablist, focus active tab

reducedMotion.behavior: Disable non-essential transitions and use instant panel switch
reducedMotion.implementation: @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) { /* disable indicator and panel animations */ }

manyTabs.solution: Use scrollable tab list with optional scroll controls or overflow menu. For menu mode, anchor trigger to tab row and keep active tab visible in primary tabs when possible.

longLabels.issue: Long labels break layout or reduce readability
longLabels.solution: Truncate with ellipsis and provide full text via title/tooltip

disabledActiveTab.issue: Current active tab becomes disabled due to state changes
disabledActiveTab.solution: Move selection to nearest enabled tab and announce update

dynamicTabs.issue: Tabs added or removed at runtime
dynamicTabs.solution: Preserve active tab when possible; reassign to valid neighbor when removed

asyncPanelContent.issue: Panel content loading causes lag in automatic mode
asyncPanelContent.solution: Use clear pending indicators with cancellation-safe async handling. If lag is high, switch to manual activation or preload likely panels.

nestedContainerOverflow.issue: Tabs inside narrow cards or flex/grid children can overflow or overlap neighboring content
nestedContainerOverflow.solution: Apply layout safety constraints for shrink behavior, wrapping, and overflow containment in tab and panel containers

overflowPopupClipping.issue: Overflow dropdown can be clipped by ancestor containers or detached from tab alignment
overflowPopupClipping.solution: Ensure overflow popup can escape clipping and remains anchored to its trigger. Keep trigger aligned with tab row baseline.

testingChecklist: One tab is active by default and associated panel is visible
Clicking a tab activates it and reveals correct panel
Horizontal keyboard navigation works with ArrowLeft/ArrowRight and wrapping
Vertical keyboard navigation works with ArrowUp/ArrowDown and wrapping
Home and End move focus to first and last tabs
Enter and Space activate focused tab in manual mode
Automatic mode activates tab on focus movement
role='tablist', role='tab', and role='tabpanel' are present
aria-selected updates correctly for active/inactive tabs
aria-controls and aria-labelledby mappings are valid and unique
Vertical mode includes aria-orientation='vertical'
Focus ring is visible on all focusable tabs
Disabled tabs cannot be activated
Roving focus keeps exactly one focusable tab stop in the tablist at a time
Disabled tabs are skipped during arrow-key focus movement
Scrollable mode keeps active tab visible
Overflow controls appear only when needed
Overflow menu trigger is aligned with tab row and does not appear visually detached
Overflow menu opens anchored to trigger and closes on outside interaction or Escape
Selecting an overflow item activates tab and closes menu
Active tab remains visible in the primary row when overflow menu is used
Many tabs remain reachable via keyboard and pointer
Only one panel is perceivable and interactive at a time
Inactive panels do not affect layout flow or overlap adjacent sections
Tabs remain stable when multiple tab instances are stacked on one page
Tabs remain stable inside constrained parent containers (for example cards or grid/flex columns)
Long labels and long panel content do not cause horizontal overflow
Panel transitions are subtle and not distracting
Reduced-motion disables or minimizes transitions
Touch targets are at least 44px high on mobile
On mobile, vertical desktop tabs degrade to a stable small-screen structure
Async tabs show pending indicator and resolve to the latest user intent
Stale async responses do not override newer tab selections
No inline styles when project uses class-based styling
